question: Carefully take off the outlet faceplate and inspect circuitry for any damage. Disconnect the main power while dismantling.
Are there any damaged parts, including anything disconnected or anything burned or melted?
Carefully remove, replace, or reconnect any non-functioning parts.
Is the outlet wired properly and grounded? Use a voltmeter to check for the output voltage and current. Ensure that the live, neutral, and ground wires are appropriate. Check the device plug.
Is the machine set to accept the proper power?
Is the plug of the appropriate pin type? The plug pin configuration should fit into the wall socket.
Is the plug in good condition? The pins shouldnâ€™t wiggle, be bent or rusted.
Fix or replace the plug and cable. Tighten pins that wiggle. Straighten any bent pins with pliers. Remove rust with sandpaper.
Obtain appropriate plug type and replace, or obtain a pin type adapter.
Alter the power of the device if possible. Otherwise, obtain the transformer of the appropriate input and output voltage.
Carefully the rewire the outlet and add a ground connection if necessary. Disconnect the main power.
Would you like to access resources, contact another technician, or continue with power supply troubleshooting?
details: To access resources, click on the document links. To contact another technician, use the call button. Press 'continue...' for more guided troubleshooting.
